meanings.definition: A device used in photography to produce a brief, intense burst of light.
meanings.sent1: The photoflash lit up the room for the picture.
meanings.sent2: I always carry a photoflash in my camera bag for indoor shots.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked over the photoflash, creating a bright distraction.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a photoflash, brightening up the entire scene.
meanings.sent5: The photoflash captured the moment in a flash of brilliance.

meanings.definition: To use a photoflash in order to illuminate a subject for a photograph.
meanings.sent1: I will photoflash the group for the group photo.
meanings.sent2: Remember to photoflash the cake before blowing out the candles.
meanings.sent3: He photoflashed the sleeping dog, causing it to wake up with a start.
meanings.sent4: The idea photoflashed in her mind, illuminating a solution to the problem.
meanings.sent5: She photoflashes every portrait, ensuring perfect lighting in her photos.
